parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

datasetStructure: One record per actual or planned visit per subject

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SV.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain most relevant to the observation. The domain abbreviation is also used as a prefix for variables to ensure uniqueness when datasets are merged.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SV.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SV.VISITNUM

datasetVariables.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Number
datasetVariables.name: VISITNUM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SV.VISIT

datasetVariables.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Name
datasetVariables.name: VISIT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SV.SVPRESP

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate whether the visit was planned (i.e., visits specified in the TV domain). Value is "Y" for planned visits, null for unplanned visits.
datasetVariables.label: Pre-specified
datasetVariables.name: SVPRESP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SV.SVOCCUR

datasetVariables.description: Used to record whether a planned visit occurred. The value is null for unplanned visits.
datasetVariables.label: Occurrence
datasetVariables.name: SVOCCUR

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SV.SVREASOC

datasetVariables.description: The reason for the value in SVOCCUR. If SVOCCUR="N", SVREASOC is the reason the visit did not occur.
datasetVariables.label: Reason for Occur Value
datasetVariables.name: SVREASOC

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C171445

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SV.SVCNTMOD

datasetVariables.description: The way in which the visit was conducted. Examples: "IN PERSON", "TELEPHONE CALL", "IVRS".
datasetVariables.label: Contact Mode
datasetVariables.name: SVCNTMOD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SV.SVEPCHGI

datasetVariables.description: Indicates whether the visit was changed due to an epidemic or pandemic.

datasetVariables.name: VISITDY
